sections.note: This section consists of 17 part questions and all are to be answered. Each question carries one mark.

questions.question: The oxidation states of the elements of group VA:
Which of the following s-block element form super oxide when burn in air:
In the equilibrium of dichromate-chromate ion the colour of CrO₄² is:
The coordination number of cobalt in Na₃[Co(C₂O₄)₃] is:
The knocking of internal combustion engine can be reduced by the following petroleum process:
How many optical isomers are possible for CH(OH)COOH CH(Br)COOH?
Which of the following pairs of compounds represent functional group isomerism:

options.D: Diethyl ketone and methyl propyl ketone

The Kinetics of Elimination biomolecular reaction is:

Clemmensen reduction is the conversion of aldehydes and ketones into:

An example of quaternary structure of protein is:

sections.note: Answer any NINE part questions. Select FOUR part questions from Inorganic-General Chemistry and FIVE part questions from Organic Chemistry. All questions carry equal marks.

questions.question: Explain the general group trend and irregularities of ionization energy in the periodic table. OR Give reasons for any four of the following: *Boiling point of halogens increases down the group in the periodic table *Electronegativity decreases regularly from top to bottom in s-block elements *Alkali metals are good conductor of electricity *Fluorine is the strongest oxidizing agent *Multidentate ligands are known as chelating agents
Give diagonal relationship on any two of the following pair: *Li and Mg *Be and Al *B and Si
Why transition elements have the tendency to form alloy? Write the name of three alloys of transition element along with their compositions.
Write down the IUPAC names of the following complexes: *[Ag(NH₃)₂]OH *[Fe(CN)₆]⁻⁴ *K₃[Cr(C₂O₄)₂Cl₂] *[Pt(en)₂(NO₂)₂]SO₄
What are Pesticides? Write the name of three types of pesticides along with their specific use.
How was ozone layer formed? Explain the causes of depletion of ozone layer.
What is proton NMR spectroscopy? On what principle it works.
How is coal produced under the earth crust? Write the name of four types of coal and mention the %age of carbon content in them. OR Define Homologous series and write its three general properties.

Draw the orbital structure of Ethyne and explain how it is distinguished from ethene by a simple chemical test. OR Give the equations and write the name of final product in the following process. *Ethyne is treated with hydrogen bromide. *1, 2-dibromoethane is heated with alcoholic KOH. *Ethene is ozonolysed *Ethyne is treated with H₂O in the presence of H₂SO₄/HgSO₄.
Write the IUPAC name of the following organic compounds: * (CH₃)₂CH - C - CH(C₂H₅)₂ * CH₃ - CH₂ - OC(CH₃)₂C₂H₅ * CH₂ = CH - C = C - CH = CH₂ * CH₃ - CH - CH - CH₂ - COOH
Why benzene show stability towards addition reaction? Write the mechanism of nitration of benzene. OR What is meant by sterio isomerism? Define Cis & Trans isomers with example.
What is Grignard reagent? Write the equation of its reaction with *H₂O *CO₂ *CH₃NH₂
Why are alkyl amines basic in nature? How a primary alkyl amine is converted into secondary and tertiary amine? Give the equation.
Name four derivative of carboxylic acid and write the equations of their preparation.

sections.note: Attempt any TWO Questions. One question from Inorganic-General Chemistry and the other from Organic Chemistry. Both questions carry equal marks.

parts.question: Describe the manufacture of H₂SO₄ by contact process and show that by equation it act as an oxidizing agent and dehydrating agent

Write the balance chemical equations for the following. *A mixture of carbon and silicon is heated under elevated temperature *Phosphorus is put into water *Bleaching powder is treated with hydrochloric acid *Chlorine gas is pass through hot aqueous solution of caustic soda *Copper is treated with concentration nitric acid *A piece of chromium is put into dilute hydrochloric acid *Reaction between KMnO₄ and FeSO₄ in the presence of H₂SO₄ (write ionic equation) *Reaction between K₂Cr₂O₇ and FeSO₄ in the presence of H₂SO₄ (write ionic equation)

Describe various steps involve in the extraction of 99.99% pure copper from its chalcopyrite ore. OR Explain the following properties of transition elements. *Catalytic property *Variable oxidation state *Paramagnetic property *Colour formation
What is meant by acid rain describe its causes and adverse effect on human life style.
What is meant by orientation of benzene? Explain ortho-para and meta directing group. Write the equation for the preparation of TNT and m-nitro toluene from benzene.
Draw the structure of the following organic molecules: *Isopropylbutanoate *Ethyl neo-pentyl ether *Divinylacetylene *p-cresol *Pyrogallol *β-methyl butyric acid *Benzamide *Benzen-1,4-dioic acid

What is meant by nucleophile? Give the mechanism of *SN¹ reaction between 3° alkyl halide and NaOH *SN² reactions between 1° alkyl halide and NaCl. OR What are Carbohydrates? Classify them on the basis of structure and give their biological significance.

Write the equation for the following reactions. *Oxidation of 2°-alcohol with K₂Cr₂O₇/H₂SO₄ *Reaction of phenol with H₂SO₄ at 20°C *Reduction of acetaldehyde with Zn(Hg) amalgam *Reaction of an aldehyde with Tollen's reagent *Dehydration of ethyl alcohol at 170°C in conc. H₂SO₄ *Reaction of ethylene glycol with periodic acid. *Reduction of acetic acid with LiAlH₄ *Oxidation of 1°-alcohol with PCC.
